MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cybertron | b: HAL 9000 | c: Skynet | d: R2-D2

MCQ: Who provided a widely quoted definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Tom M. Mitchell | b: Alan Turing | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Donald Hebb

MCQ: What is one of the objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To build robots | b: To classify data based on developed models | c: To predict the weather | d: To perform surgery

MCQ: What is a hypothetical algorithm specific to classifying data that was mentioned in the text?
